"I'll be borrowing the bathroom to wash up."

Once Weiss reached to the other side of the Dorm where their bathroom is, she opens the bathroom door before pausing, "Oh and Ruby? Don't even think about looking through my Dust!"

With that, the heiress went to the bathroom while Ruby just pouted from her spot.

Then she smirked, "Well... it's not like she would notice anything strange if I move fast enough~!"

With that Ruby puts her Comic down and briefly used her Semblance before she carefully opened the briefcase and began inspecting each vial of powdered Dust, "Let's see what we have here... some Ice Dust, not surprising... Fire Dust... Lightning Dust..."

After a few minutes, Ruby decided that she had seen enough was about to close the case when she noticed another vial of powdered Dust that she had somehow missed, "Hmm? What's this?"

Picking the vial up Ruby saw that it was filled with Dust... only of a type that she does not recognize and was a rather odd color.

"What kind of Dust is this? Gravity? No, it would've been purple..."

Ruby was so focused on this unknown Dust that she didn't notice the bathroom door had opened and that Weiss was not pleased seeing her partner rummaging through her briefcase, "RUBY! What are you doing?!"

"W-Weiss! I was just-!"

But in her panic, Ruby accidentally dropped the vial she was holding causing it to shatter on the floor, releasing the Dust and cover Ruby completely while Weiss stood in disbelief and shock at what her partner just did. But at the same time, she was also confused at what kind of Dust she was looking at as the color of the Dust alone was something that she had never seen before.

Neither of the two girls said anything as the cloud of Dust slowly dissipated as Ruby coughed and closed her eyes when...

The now 10 feet Ruby looked down at Weiss in confusion, "Huh? What do you mean?"

1112.content:
It is a sunny weekend and since classes are not in session, one particular black and red clothed girl is bored out of her mind, “I’m bored!” Ruby Rose exclaimed lying on Weiss’s bed in her Team ’s dorm.

The rest of her team had plans of their own for the day; her partner Weiss went to the CCT for “family matters”, Blake went to a new bookstore that was just recently opened and Yang... well, Ruby had no idea what her half-sister is up to other than casually saying she needed to train more.

She sighed, “I already did maintenance on Crescent Rose and even played some video games on my Scroll. What else am I supposed to do now?”

As Ruby pondered on what to do next, her stomach suddenly growled!

“Well, I guess that answers my question.” Ruby said with a blush as she got off the bed and headed out to mess hall and see if there is something to eat.

When Ruby finally arrived and entered the mess hall she wasn’t surprised that no one was inside at the moment, meaning the few weekend faculty kitchen staff were likely out in the City of Vale for whatever their own reasons were.

Regardless, Ruby smiled as she skipped to the kitchen and before long she was in front of the refrigerator.

“Let’s see what’s inside.” She said as she opened the refrigerator door and took a look.
Inside there were a few different kinds of food neatly arranged but her eyes lit up as she quickly locked onto a plastic container filled with cookies topped with chocolate ships and *gasp* strawberries!

Ruby licked her lips, "Ooo, those cookies look so good! And they’re topped with strawberries, my favorite!"

But just as she was about to grab the container, she noticed that there is also a small milk carton with an unlabeled symbol that she has never seen before.

"Hmm, must be a new brand. And I am kind of thirsty." Ruby muttered as she inquisitively analyzed the milk then looked back at the Cookies, and then back at the milk before she shrugged.

"Eh, why not just have both?” she said before she grabbed both the cookie-filled container and the small milk carton before closing the refrigerator door.

Exiting the kitchen, Ruby quickly sat down at one of the tables and quickly opened the container and milk carton.

Ruby paused, “Should I have gotten a glass for the milk?” she pondered before shaking her head, “Nah~, I’ll dip cookies in milk some another time.”

With that, Ruby set upon the cookies first and instantly loved them the moment the first one was devoured. Then she tried the milk.

“Hmm, there’s a slight taste that I can’t put my finger on it. But all in all, it's not bad!”

It didn’t take a minute for Ruby to finish eating the cookies before downing the entire milk carton with a satisfied sigh.

“Pah~! Like I told Yang back on initiation, I don’t need help growing up, I drink MILK!” Ruby declared while raising the empty milk carton in victory.

After gathering everything, Ruby went back to the kitchen and threw the carton in the trash while placing the empty container on the kitchen counter and leaving a note thanking and apologizing for having the cookies for herself but enjoyed very much.

“Well!” Ruby started as she walked out of the kitchen before stopping before the first row of tables with her hands on her hips, “I’ve had my fill and I suppose I could go into Vale and see if there is anything else to do!”

But before Ruby took a few steps forward toward the main doors, her stomach suddenly growled and bubbled loudly causing her to bend over and clutch her stomach in pain.

Ruby groaned before she thought back to the milk, “I forgot to check if that milk had already past the expiration date-!“

“Groooooowl!” Her stomached now suddenly roared causing Ruby to fall on her knees as the pain intensified and now spread throughout her body!

Tearfully, Ruby feebly pleaded for help, “Ooh... it hurts! S-somebody... help me...”

Little did she know, this was only the start of something bigger.

1512.content:
The forest of Forever Fall was a sea of vibrant red, overlaid against the sunset sky to produce a warm sight. Normally serene as a landscape painting, a small section of the forest shook & rattled across the vista, leaves flying, trees falling, ruining the serene, static image.

"RATATATATATATAT" In the center of the forest's action, the barrel of Gianduja rotated, expelling high-velocity Dust bullets that exploded on impact against the trunks of the forest trees, causing them to fall to pieces, a black phantom darting from each wooden corpse as it fell to tatters. Coco rotated in place at a steady pace, matching the Geist as it tried to flee, firing into whatever it tried to possess until it was left with no options to run. Tree by tree burst at the combination of Coco's Semblance & her bullets, sending a haze of wooden dust & dirt particles everywhere, creating a coffee-colored fog of war befitting of her team name; the Geist would eventually have nowhere to go, and her gun would impact against its bony mask, sending the Grimm to the great beyond - mission complete.

"We're done with the stragglers. Have you finished the Geist yet, Coco?" The thoughts of her teammate, Fox, rang in Coco's mind - a telepathy channel used to keep the team together, even when separated, constantly updating one another on their Grimm quarry.

"Not yet," she replied, "Little sucker's really moving around fast. Start coming towards the cloud of dust, guys, one of you might be able to get it on its next round." The Geist kept making circles around Coco, trying to move from tree to tree for some form of a body to strike back, but the fashionista wasn't having it, she put all of her Hype into each & every round to turn the mighty oaks to mere woodchips upon immediate impact - she was almost toying with it in a sense. "Ah, ah, ah," she mocked, "Those suits are far out of your value, stud." Coco was having fun messing with the Geist on some level, taking joy in blowing up the wilderness, but it had to come to an end at some point, else her professors would be mad at her for defacing one of Remnant's most beautiful forests.

The Geist couldn't agree more, this had to end. It changed its trajectory, coming in closer towards Coco, risking the bullet hailstorm - it darted towards a couple mid-sized rocks, ones that could do some damage if possessed, but failed to dash quickly enough as it exploded into a gray mist of particles. The Geist wasn't deterred, it dashed towards more stones, closer and closer to Coco, which she quickly destroyed with her gun. The visibility was getting poor at this point, Coco could barely see through the haze as is with her sunglasses, it didn't help the cloud was getting larger & closer to her the more she fired. "What's it doing? Is it trying to make a tornado or something to possess? I can't see with this- wait a second..." Coco slowed her firing rate for a moment, taking a moment to think - a wry smile formed on her lips as she figured out the Geist's gambit. She slowly released her finger from the trigger and begun to back up, letting her gun change back to its basic purse form, feigning huffing in a panic - if her intuition was right, the Geist would be coming for her any moment now. As if on cue, a bright yellow light came from behind Coco's field of view - the Geist charged at her with its claws, ready to slice her in two...

The Geist felt the weight of Gianduja's purse format press directly into its mask, cracking it in multiple places. The phantasm shrieked in pain and fumbled against the dirt floor, its body dissipating into a black mist. Coco swung her purse over her shoulder and chuckled - those meditation & sensory exercises Yatsuhashi & Fox taught her really paid off. Coco backed up towards where the Geist disappeared, her upper body feeling sore from all the twisting & arm-movement to chase the Geist; she moved her back against a soft, tall forest mushroom, one strange oddity of nature in Forever Fall, and leaned back into it, letting the coziness soothe her muscles. "The Geist is down." Coco shot out through Fox's channel. "Mission complete." Coco sunk to the ground and sat down, she was really going to need a hot bath & nap when she got back to Beacon; CFVY's team leader was quite thankful for the therapeutic shifting the mushroom was doing on her back, almost like a massage chair...

"Wait, why's this moving so much?" Coco tilted her head upwards, and from behind the hem of her shades, she came eye-to-eye with a few surviving sections of the Geist's mask, eye glowing gold in rage. Coco tried to dart upwards, but in an act of revenge, the Geist shook, spraying an orange pollen around its new body, making a new cloud of particles where the old one just began to disperse. Coco coughed in a panic, swinging Gianduja around as she backed up - her eyes teared up and she couldn't see through the stinging sensation, the Geist could've been primed to attack for all she knew. Indeed, it was - a root of the mushroom tore from the ground, and was primed to strike Coco across the face...

"Coco!" a female voice with a heavy accent cried from above. The Geist tried to turn and react, but was powerless as a brown-haired girl with rabbit ears fell from the sky, splitting the mushroom & mask in half with a translucent scythe. The Geist let out one final, pathetic cry as the bunny-girl swung the scythe around, spinning on her toes in a kneeling position - the Grimm's black mist & orange pollen dissipated, and as the sky cleared, so did the girl's weapon, disappearing into shining particles of Dust. The girl, the rabbit Faunus Velvet, leapt to her feet and ran towards her team leader, wrapping her arms around the beret-wearing girl for support. "Coco! Are you okay?! What was that orange stuff it shot?"

"I'm fine, V." Coco coughed out, "It was just mushroom spores, it stings a bit, but it's nothing that the medical room at Beacon can't deal with." As Coco spoke, she continued to cough and clear her throat mid-sentence, rubbing her eyes with her free hand to clear the tears. Coco was putting on a brave front, but Velvet was still concerned for her leader - she looked at the remains of the mushroom the Geist once possessed.

"I dunno," she replied, "I've never seen a mushroom that large before, let alone that shape or color. It might be poisonous for all we know..."

"I'm fine, Velvet, really." Coco tried to stand up straight, but found herself fidgeting a little bit, rubbing her hands across her upper body, a chilly sensation pulsing through her muscles. Despite the internal struggle, Coco continued to proclaim she was fine, standing erect and fixing her sunglasses on her face. "Let's just get in contact with Fox & Yatsu, I want to get home before whatever that was sets into my clothes..." Velvet looked down her team leader one more time, feeling a little concerned as she watched Coco keep rubbing her hands against her shoulders, like something was a matter with her.

"Fox? Yatsu? It's Velvet, I've retrieved Coco. The Geist is dead, and all other Grimm should be exterminated here for now."

"Is Coco alright?" Fox's voice rang back.

"She says she is, but she was exposed to these spores from a strange mushroom the Geist possessed. We need to get her back to Beacon immediately."

"Got it. Head north to the forest clearing, we'll rendezvous there while Yatsu & I hail a helicopter."

"Roger." With the communication line ceased, Velvet got under Coco's left arm and wrapped it around her neck, carrying Coco against her back as the fashionable young woman shuddered. "Come on now, Coco, let's get you back in bed."

"T-Thanks, V. But slow down a bit, I have a headache, and- ack!"

"Ack?"

"It's my boots, something's up with them. Damn, I thought these things would've at least lasted me until the end of my time here. I'll have to go get a new pair made..." Coco shivered as if she was chilly, or her body was fighting off some sort of infection, but to the leader of Team CFVY, Coco was blissfully unaware of the reaction the frenzied spores were having on her body...

Velvet wasn't a mean girl, in fact most people who knew her well enough could tell she didn't have a single mean bone in her body. Even when her teammates had offered to rough up the ignorant boy, she talked them down. Her leader Coco wasn't happy, but in the end she and the rest of team CVFY could only respect Velvet's decision.

But, even the kindest of people can only be pushed so far. Cardin had taken her kindness for weakness, a mistake most people are taught not to make. Because Velvet didn't fight back, the leader of team CRDL thought he could do whatever he pleased to her without any repercussions.

Wrong!

Unknown to him, he had finally managed to due the near impossible. Make. Velvet. Angry! He had managed to achieve this great feat during lunch when he had committed the greatest sin against her. He'd upgraded from simple taunts and name calling to physical assault. Cardin Winchester made the biggest mistake of his short life when he grabbed her ears.

Even when she begged him to stop, he only laughed in her face. He pulled and pulled until he managed to make her cry in front o the whole cafeteria. It didn't matter to him that he hurt and embarrassed her. It only served to make him feel superior.

That's when Velvet knew she finally had enough!

Cardin needed to be taught a lesson. The teachers clearly weren't going to give it to him! So it was all down to her to teach him a lesson he'd never forget. For the first time in her life, Velvet was going to entertain the idea of an eye for an eye. She was going to get even. She was going to make Cardin understand what it felt like to be small... Literally.

It took weeks of planning, but she finally had everything she needed to get her revenge. Unfortunately for the rest of team CFVY, they weren't invited to the party. That extended to the rest of team CRDL as well. It would be just her and her long time oppressor. Velvet lost track of how long she spent shadowing Cardin. Learning his patterns and mannerism. At this point she felt like she knew her bully better than her own teammates.

That didn't matter though, today was the day she'd brake Cardin Winchester. Everything was set up smoothly. First she'd lure Cardin away, deep into the Emerald Forest where no cameras would see them, and no scroll signal could reach the academy. Next she'd bust out her secret weapon. She did feel guilty about stealing it from the Schnee girl, but what she didn't know wouldn't hurt her. Then... The fun would begin. All Velvet had to do was wait.

After about an hour of waiting a familiar voice came calling through the Emerald Forest. "Hello!? Nikos!? You out here!? I got your text!"

Velvet couldn't help but giggle from behind her hiding spot. As if the 'invincible girl' would ever be interested in him.

Cardin heard the rustling of a nearby bush and smirked. "Hey babe! That you?"

It was showtime.

Instead of being greeted by the idol of Beacon Academy, he was greeted by the rabbit of Vale. "What are you doing here flopsy?" he asked in annoyance.

Velvet merely smiled. "Who? Me? I called you here. Did you really think you were coming here to see Pyrrha? You're not her type."

Cardin growled in anger, he'd been duped. He quickly regained his composure however and gave the brunette a cocky grin. "So you called me out here? All by yourself? No teammates? That wasn't very smart." Yes he came unarmed like the text said, but he didn't need a mace to put this animal in her place. "I guess I'm gonna have to teach you another lesson, flopsy."

Much to his surprise, the rabbit didn't look worried or scared at all. In fact she was unnervingly calm. Velvet simply shook her head and stared back at her school bully who had yet grasp the severity of his situation. "You know I'm a year ahead of you correct. That makes me your upperclassmen."

"Your point?"

"As an upperclassmen it's my duty to look out for underclassmen. So now I'm going to educate you. I'm going to learn you a lesson in respect." Velvet declared.

Cardin simply cracked his knuckles. "I've heard enough out of you. Now it's go time."

"I couldn't agree more." Velvet then pulled a vial of pitch black dust from behind her back. "Now I'll educate you." Velvet smashed the dust vial on the ground beneath her and Cardin could only look on in confusion as one of his favorite puppies to kick was engulfed by the dark mist. All he could hear was the sound of Velvets frantic coughs and soon broke out in hysterical laughter. He didn't need to do a damn thing. The stupid animal would defeat herself.

His laughter soon halted when another sound reached his ear. The sound if something tearing. It was then he noticed the coughing ceased and instead the tearing sound continued on. Just what was happening in that mist?

Cardin quickly wished he didn't know. Deep inside the mist Velvet had managed to stop coughing but it still felt as if her lungs were on fire. Honestly her whole body felt as if it was heating up. Then she felt a tingling sensation deep within her gut. The first thing she felt was the tightness of her school uniform on her body. She could feel the very fabric holding it together being strained to the limit as her body began to expand.

The fabric began to tear in all sorts of places and she could feel her shoes instantly give out as they were torn asunder. Her uniform tore completely now, leaving her as bare as the day she entered the world. Thankfully she thought to not wear any underwear in preparation for today. She could soon see over the black mist as everything around her seemed to move farther and farther away. She just kept climbing and climbing until the trees could barely reach her knees.

Cardin stood wide-eyed, mouth agape at the sight. That puny little rabbit faunus just underwent one hell of a growth spurt. When she finally did stop growing, Cardin for the first time in his life felt a sense of real fear around the rabbit faunus.

"Wow. I didn't think I'd get this big." Velvet said in awe of her new size. She could see over every tree and almost over the mountains. As she looked around marveling at the view, a small little 'bug' came into her field of vision. That bug was none other the whimpering form of Cardin Winchester who had fallen flat on his backside. That was when she remembered what she was here for. "So tell me!" her voice boomed. "How does it feel to be so small?"

Cardin couldn't answer, he was far to scared.

"Now then! Let the lesson begin."

"Now then! Let the lesson begin."

Beacon! All he had to do was make it back to school and he'd be home free. The teachers could deal with this monster. That was the plan. Too bad no plan survives first contact with the enemy. Cardin didn't get very far before a giant bare foot cut off his escape route. He slammed into it hard and was sent sprawling to the ground.

"Going somewhere?" Velvet asked with barely hidden amusement. She couldn't believe how easy it was to stop her bully dead in his tracks. She didn't really have to do anything except take a step forward. Seeing him fall back the way he did gave her a warm feeling in her chest. Was this how Cardin felt when he messed with her?

The downed leader of team CRDL quick shook off the cobwebs and got to hi feet again. He looked up a the giant foot which to him seemed as big as a bullhead. Fear tore through him as he tried to make a break for it yet again. Velvet saw this and cut off his escape for the second time.

Instead of getting right back up, Cardin propped himself up on his elbows and watched as the giant rabbit faunus giggled as his expense. A part of him felt angry, but the more rational part of his mind felt terrified.

It took everything he had not to piss his pants. "N-no!"

"Good!" Velvet smiled. "If you did I would've caught you, you know. You wouldn't want that because at your size you look mighty tasty."

Cardin blanched when he heard that. He didn't want to become some rabbit's dinner. "P-please don't eat me! I'm sorry, okay?! I am so, so sorry!"

He looked at the massive foot and toes presented before him and winced. She'd flatten him. He needed to get away, but all his attempts so far have been futile.

"So explain to me again why we, you are in such a rush?"

Weiss Schnee asked her excitable friend and partner Ruby Rose as she continued to get strung along by the younger girl.

"Because Weiss our enemies are getting stronger which means we have to get stronger too."

"Might I remind you that after some time apart, not by choice mind you, you, me, Blake, and Yang are back together as a team."

"True but we're awesome as a team but I'm taking Yang's advice about getting our muscles stronger not just our fighting skills."

Ruby momentarily striking a bicep pose as she continued to pull Weiss along. It wasn't much especially compared to her sister but it sometimes surprised her how Ruby could just up and drag her some where just as she was currently doing.

'Maybe I should work on my own personal strength...' Weiss wondered before being interrupted her thoughts announcing that they were here! Here was a gym that Yang had told Ruby about, apparently the blonde wanted to bring along Blake but Oscar(well more like Ozpin) pulled the raven-haired girl aside so the passes Yang had bought were passed down to her sis and Weiss, who wanted to state she had no interest but before she could she was zipped away in a flash of crimson.

So here she was standing outside a gym and sticking out like a sore thumb with her formal wear, Ruby wasn't much better so there was that but her eagerness to get stronger made her blend in more with the regulars.

Moments later the two were inside Ruby eager to get to work improving her strength and Weiss not really sure what to do, she had never really worked out as hard as some of the individuals were leaving her rather lost. Thankfully Ruby noticed this and offer to lend Weiss a hand stating that the two should work out together.

"How exactly?" Weiss asked still a bit puzzled.

"Well..." Ruby paused as she scanned the area around the two of them.

15522222222222222222222111.content:
Weiss adored her sister Winter, throughout her life she had been her example. Her role model, her ideal. A brave, strong, disciplined, sophisticated woman. She had slipped away from the bonds of their father, and managed to forge her own path with the Atlesian military, regardless of their father's wishes.

Winter was all Weiss wanted to be, so whenever Winter had free time the heiress would take every opportunity to spend it with her. That included training, her sister was responsible for building the foundations of what would become her fighting style, teaching her in the craft of their family's hereditary semblance.

Weiss loved her sister dearly, ever thankful for all she had done for her.

"Don't you dare stop now you daintly little girl!"

...That is not to say that sometimes her sister didn't make it easy sometimes.

The heiress watched as the ground grew close and furthered away, only to grow close once again. Breathing with effort as she pushed her arms up and down. Weiss sincerely hated physical training, but she knew it was vital for any Huntsman.

Weiss was sure Winter was currently channeling all that experience from the training she recieved at the military academy at Atlas. The same type drill Sergeants subjugated the students to. Winter watched her with a heavy critical gaze, donning a military white coat, arms crossed behind her back, as Weiss continued with the pushups.

The heiress was currently wearing not her usual white dress, but white yoga pants along with a white sports braw, her body sweat until there was a small puddle under her face, her arms were starting to protest in agony. She had lost count how many she had done so far, well, she did not count at all to begin with. Winter had not set a required number of pushups, she had just ordered her to do them until she said it was enough.

Thankfully, Winter finally decided to be merciful. "That's enough, take five"

Weiss collapsed on the ground, gasping for breath. To merely remain still for a moment was a blessing after this.

Winter harrumphed in disappointment. "Your physical fitness leaves much to be desired, Weiss"

The heiress managed to find the strength to sit down. "I'm not a physical fighter like Yang... I'm built for agility and casting"

"Both which means nothing if your body can't handle the pressure of combat" Her sister repriminded. "You need to build up your stamina and body strength, develop those paltry muscles of yours"

Weiss didn't dare roll her eyes, but she definitely wanted too. "I'm not sure I want muscles"

"Whether you want them or not is irrelevant. You need to be in better shape"

"I don't think I'm the type to build that type of body anyway"

Winter's eyes narrowed, making Weiss wince, thinking she had said something wrong. "Not the type huh? Then by that logic neither should I be"

Before Weiss' eyes, Winter began removing the upper parts of her attire. Her younger sister could see a black sports bra as she unbotted the coat.

It soom came off, leaving Weiss gawking.
15522222222222222222222111.title: Muscle growth

155222222222222222222221112.content:
Weiss was a person who prided herself in possessing a wide range of vocabulary and elegant choice in vernacular. But at the sight of her sister's body there was only one word that came to mind (one that Yang herself would use no doubt)

Winter was ripped

With her military coat off, and left in a simple black sports bra that hung tight around her chest, along with strentched yoga pants, Winter's oustandingly developed body was in full display.

Her forarms were corded and thick, leading the way to bulging inches of unflexed biceps and protounding triceps. Her deltoids were large balls of flesh split into the different muscle groups in a noticeable way. Her torso managed to blend perfectly a curved womanly figure while possessing a wide musculature, Six abdominal muscles of amazing definition, and several visible muscle groups around them, protected her stomach like a steadfast shield. Where her abdomen ended and her upper body started, her lats flared somewhat with her arms relaxed at the side, her prodigious chest (something which Weiss has always been secretely jealous of) was supported by two thick pecturals, corded muscles with shredded definition in the middle.Though her legs remained hidden, the yoga pants did little to conceal their size. Wide thighs and diamond carved calves filled out the fabric and pushed it to its limits, her rear standing out nicely due to the iron-like glutes.

Winter took a deep breath, and brought her fists closed to her hips. Her lats spreading as her chest heaved, her abs tightening as she flexed her upper body. Her biceps bulged a few inches foward, the skin tightened to show off greater definition.

Weiss simply had her breath stolen. She had never imagined her sister could look like... this. There was no sense of grotesque at her figure, no manliness about it. Winter blended feminity and raw strength, granting her still an air of elegance and authority about her.

"I adquired this body through my own efforts, do you consider still consider the task of building up yours impossible?" She asked and without waiting for an answer continued. "Or is it that you see a woman with this physique to be an embarrasment? Foolish notions of society, my body has nothing to do with appereances, I honed my muscles to serve me better on the field"

"N-No no it's nothing like that!" Weiss vehemently denied, though secretely she had been worried about appereances, something she didn't dare confess to her sister. "I'm just... surprised. You look so... so strong" Those were the only words that came to mind, she didn't know what to say. Compliment her sister on her figure? Say how amazing she looked like that?

Weiss could admit that, yes, her sister looked incredible.

"A strong body for a strong mind. Here" To the heiress' surprise, her elder sister grabbed a hold of her hand and placed it on her abdominals. "Feel this"

"W-Winter!"

"We're sisters, there's nothing to be ashamed of. Do you feel how hard my abs are?" Winter let Weiss press her hand on her own.

As her fingertips hesitantly touched the bags of muscles, growing more and more bold as they fulley reached out to feel, yes, Weiss felt how amazingly hard they felt underneath her sister's flawless skin. It felt... good. She blushed in embarresment, and something else she couldn't fully describe. But touching Winter's muscles felt... intriguing.

"Now feel this" Winter bent to the side and her up her bicep, flexing it with all her strength, forcing the muscle to rise and tighten. Her skin showed flawless definition as Weiss saw a few veins rising along the length, continuing forth all the way to her forarms.

Weiss slowly reached foward with both her hands this time, feeling the mound of flesh of the bicep while her other hand cupped the tricept, her palms tenderly running over the hard flesh. The sheer strenght in that muscle, the hardness, the... the beauty. Yes, Weiss realized as the heat gathered in her cheeks and she let out a nearly silent but shaky breath, Winter was beautiful. Her amazonian body was making her feel things she had not experienced before, perhaps things one should not feel for a sibling.

She moved her lips to utter one simple question, a desire that was steadily building up strength inside of her that she just needed to satiate.
